Text:
In my address to #AKLeg, I emphasized the power of bipartisanship.

My commitment to working with my colleagues led to the bipartisan infrastructure law, which will bring great benefits to our state & make our communities safer, healthier, and stronger.  
https://t.co/HFFCtyHLNB
How can the Biden administration possibly watch Russia leverage Europe on natural gas, and then decide to put the United States in the exact same position on minerals?

It’s stunning: on the very same day @POTUS attempted to tout ‘progress’ on mineral development, his administration backtracked and set back this crucial project, which will enable Alaska to responsibly produce a range of needed minerals.
Today @Interior took steps to reopen the Record of Decision for the Ambler Road project—despite having already received final federal approval. https://t.co/fOexhrD4ql

I’m thankful for the opportunity to be in Juneau—back at the State Capitol—and for the chance to speak with state leaders about my optimism for the state and the people we serve. https://t.co/m9zhZSok4B

So that’s my hope, my governing prayer, for 2022: that we’ll wake up every morning, channel Ted, and say “to hell with politics.” That we’ll seek common ground, find it, and in doing so, do right by the state we love and the people we serve.

I’m optimistic because of all the good things the delegation has been able to deliver for Alaska, and because of the resolve and resiliency of the Alaskan people. The lesson I take is that we will overcome and accomplish great things by working together.
That’s working together, side by side, so that we can actually get things done. Good governance. Responsible governance.
I don’t pretend to have all the answers for every problem that arises. No one does. But I do know a good way to find solutions.

Alaskans are facing the highest inflation in 40 years. Everything costs more. Family budgets are stretched thin. And businesses big and small are struggling to find enough employees to keep their doors open.  
 
This is causing pain everywhere. We’ve got to address it.

The United States should halt all seafood imports from Russia until they lift their ban on ours. @SenDanSullivan & I have legislation to impose a reciprocal embargo on Russian imports. We’re pushing for it to move on a standalone basis and as part of any Russia sanctions package.
The recent fisheries disaster declarations bring welcome relief, albeit way too late, but still coming. This also includes the extra visas the administration is making available for seasonal workers

We must protect our fisheries for generations to come. We expect another incredible return in Bristol Bay, but we know we’ll need workers. We’ve secured funding for the Pacific Salmon Treaty & fisheries surveys.
We’ve included provisions to expand victims’ access to medical forensic exams and improve access to care for all victims of violence.

I’m working w/ my colleagues to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act (VAWA). It includes my provisions to address teen dating violence named for Breanna Moore, who was murdered by her boyfriend in 2014.

Greater production of Alaska’s resources would be good news, not bad, for our efforts to address climate change. We don’t flare our gas; we re-inject it. Our production is cleaner and results in fewer emissions than most other places.

Between my Energy Act of 2020 & the infrastructure bill, we authorized & allocated more than $70B to new technologies. & a global phase-down of the use of ultra-warming hydrofluorocarbons will avoid up to half a degree of projected warming.
And every day, I remind them that refusing to permit those activities will have harmful consequences.

If there was ever a time for realism to prevail on resource development, it is right now. Every day, I remind the Biden administration of the immense benefits of Alaska production—energy & minerals alike.

There is no question the resources we have in Alaska are needed by our country and the world. Just look at oil prices, how Russia has leveraged Europe over natural gas, and soaring global demand for minerals.

These advances – along with the radar expansion at Clear, and the addition of new missiles for defense at Fort Greely – these are going to bring new service members to our state, along with many opportunities for civilian and support jobs.

We’ve directed each military service to release an Arctic strategy. And we established the Ted Stevens Center for Arctic Security Studies in Anchorage to further the Department of Defense’s focus on security cooperation in the High North.
Alaska remains the “most strategic place in the world.” Military commanders know that value, and we need to work with them to fulfill it.

A full-scale invasion would lead to a catastrophic loss of life & have massive implications for the security of Baltic states, for NATO, for the positioning of American forces around the world, and even for the Arctic and us in Alaska—given our location directly to Russia’s east.
As of this morning, Nord Stream 2 has been halted. Sanctions are being imposed. That's absolutely necessary. And we are entering a new phase of this crisis.

We’ve witnessed the largest troop buildup in Europe since World War II along Ukraine’s borders, and an invasion, and what we feared, appears to have begun. Russia is threatening not just Ukraine, but the international order and norms that have prevailed for decades.
Another vital aspect of Alaska’s future is with regard to our role in national defense. We’re all glued to seeing what news is coming out in regard to Russia and Ukraine.
My message to those who are thinking about visiting is simple: the cruise industry is taking every precaution to ensure a safe trip, and Alaska is ready to host you for the trip of your lifetime.
I’ve already introduced legislation to make that waiver permanent because the strength of our economy should never depend on decisions made in another country.

In Southeast, and all around the state, we know how hard the tourism-based economy has been hit. That’s why it was so important that we secured a waiver from the Passenger Vessel Services Act last summer, that allowed the first cruise ships to return to our ports since 2019.

This infrastructure bill only became law a few months ago, but it is already delivering real results. More than $600 million has already been announced for our state, from the Port of Nome to the Denali Park Road, and there is a lot more to come.

As we gain those benefits, we will create jobs. We will restore and grow our economy. We will improve Alaskans’ quality of life. And we’ll leave a healthier, more resilient, better developed, and still beautiful state for our children.
Our bipartisan infrastructure bill is now law. And over the next five years, it will bring sustained benefits to both rural and urban communities across Alaska.

These past two years have been hard. But as I stand in front of the Alaska State Legislature today, I’m optimistic. I believe Alaska is well-positioned for a new era of opportunity, growth, and prosperity, thanks in part to many of the actions we’ve taken in Congress.
I’ll be speaking to the Alaska State Legislature in a joint session at 11 a.m. AKST today, where I’ll be sharing my efforts to represent all Alaskans in Washington, D.C.  https://t.co/bGjPDfRdtd

I enjoyed hosting a townhall for over 40 mayors, city managers, and local leaders from across Alaska to speak to the bipartisan infrastructure law. I’m looking forward to Alaska’s leaders using these federal funds to strengthen infrastructure in our state. https://t.co/mpxIuzZ5kh https://t.co/757etOArBD

.@SenatorCardin and I introduced a bill that will improve access to cancer screenings, preventative surgeries, and save lives. 

During #CancerPrevention Month & beyond, this bill will increase access to testing and preventative surgeries. 

https://t.co/AYP0IMF27k

I was honored to speak at this year’s @AKASYMCA Salute to the Military dinner. I appreciate the honorees, their families, and all of our military community for their service to America, Alaska, and each other. https://t.co/uJuwAlqNTC

As seafood processors, fishermen & communities recover from COVID, I recognize the need for support & want Alaskans to know I will continue to fight for them. I’m pleased to announce the seafood industry will receive a $30M grant to recoup COVID losses. https://t.co/7lFh6UypAh
There is no better storyteller than a fisherman. I’m glad to see that stories and oral histories from Gulf of Alaska fishermen will live on in the Library of Congress. https://t.co/D0vWt50Bfa
It was great to meet with student groups from Fairbanks and the Kenai Peninsula visiting our nation’s capital this week. https://t.co/bcc2ecm7hQ

Stay safe, Alaskans.

Follow @AlaskaDOTPF for road updates. https://t.co/vwn2Z4Nljo
Alaska’s economy and our communities should not be at the mercy of decisions made by the Canadian government and I will do whatever is needed to ensure Alaskans can prosper. https://t.co/RLWbVYqHwy

The bipartisan resolution I proudly supported, which unanimously passed the Senate, sends a clear message: The U.S. Senate supports an independent and democratic Ukraine against any further Russian military invasion.  https://t.co/GLqGuES3JS

I am honored to recognize the Black Americans in Alaska whose hard work and sacrifices contributed powerfully to the Alaskan experience. This month we reaffirm unequivocally that Black history is American history, and the shared history of Alaska. https://t.co/XpSkxVruBl https://t.co/DS4dG4LNwD
#BlackHistoryMonth marks an opportunity to highlight and celebrate Black culture and our collective pride in the many achievements and contributions of Black Americans.

We’ve seen an alarming increase in mental and behavioral health issues & suicide attempts in Alaska. My legislation with @SenJackyRosen will provide support to schools to enhance and expand mental and behavioral health services for students grades K-12. 

https://t.co/kAXpKgfsSv

My floor speech in honor and recognition of Elizabeth Peratrovich Day—an incredible Alaska Native leader and champion for civil rights. Elizabeth left a legacy of seeking and realizing a more inclusive society and certainly a more representative democracy. https://t.co/i8N9AdIhUF

Congress has a bipartisan goal to deter Russia from invading Ukraine, but also to impose severe sanctions if that happens. I believe it is imperative that we have a unified front.

A united Congress on the matter of sanctions is a powerful message in and of itself. https://t.co/PbtQ7rxPN8

WATCH: I spoke to aspects of the Russia-Ukraine crisis receiving less attention so far, including how an invasion could destabilize the Arctic, poor energy policy in the US strengthening Russia’s hand, & exploring restricting imports of Russian seafood. https://t.co/GD6HKz5L0v

Today we celebrate Elizabeth Peratrovich—a Tlingit woman, relentless champion for civil rights in Alaska, and driving force behind the passage of the nation’s first anti-discrimination law. Her legacy of fighting for Alaska Native rights lives on today. 

#ElizabethPeratrovichDay https://t.co/CtFRzQDua9

It is unfair that Russia has unlimited access to sell its seafood in the United States while America’s fishermen and seafood processors – especially Alaskans - have no access to markets in Russia. The embargo needs to end or we need to incorporate reciprocal measures. https://t.co/2dJo1byg6T
We often talk about how valuable the #Arctic region is, but it can be useful only if we use it. And I’m afraid we too often neglect its importance. It’s time we change that. https://t.co/iNefhX9dqw

Our bipartisan #VAWA reauthorization will have positive impacts across Alaska. I appreciate the support for this critically-needed legislation from Angelina Trujillo at the Alaska Comprehensive Forensic Training Academy. https://t.co/d2rSOBc3L1

If there was ever a moment for energy realism, it is right now. The Biden administration & many in Congress need to recognize the immense benefits of resource production. They need to see the immense consequences of refusing to allow those activities to proceed. https://t.co/S8C2o2zpMK

There is a lot to understand about the crisis in Ukraine. How an invasion could lead to catastrophic escalation & loss of life. How this situation impacts the US whether we want to involve ourselves or not & how a diplomatic solution still exists, if Russia chooses such a path. https://t.co/fQ6fImAU6P

If we can bring a sanctions package to the floor, I will be asking my colleagues to consider two additions: one to restrict imports of Russian seafood, and a second related to Russian energy. https://t.co/NNGgm9SHDD

As the Senate works on a sanctions package to deter Russia from invading Ukraine, including imposing severe punishments in the event an invasion is carried out, I spoke about additional steps the Senate should take to address the situation. https://t.co/QBiBSsBLWH

It was great to speak with @ALSAdvocacy today—their consistent advocacy is bringing new hope to this community. With their support, we were able to get the #ACTforALS signed into law, which will make a meaningful difference for individuals across the country & help #EndALS. https://t.co/vx0Umi5EoA

Time flies. My best Valentine’s Day was 29 years ago when Matt was born. 
Happy birthday Matt! https://t.co/8h9tjucnaQ
https://t.co/8pGKQ6jvFO

Under current @USCG policy, members may hesitate to seek needed mental health treatment for fear of a blanket discharge policy. My legislation will update policies, creating a more supportive environment by allowing those who protect our nation the opportunity to seek out help.

Thank you to Cindy and Butch Moore, the parents of Bree Moore, for their longstanding efforts to address teen dating violence through #VAWA. Their work is making a difference, & I’m proud we secured Bree’s Law into VAWA to both honor their daughter & help youth in the future. https://t.co/GvOyA5iaAc

I’m proud we secured Bree’s Law, named for Alaskan Breanna Moore who was murdered by her boyfriend, into #VAWA. Creating education initiatives to enable youth, parents, & advocates to recognize, prevent, & mitigate teen dating violence will save lives.
https://t.co/OoPSZ32dEn

Americans—& especially Alaskans—have been facing a one-sided Russian embargo on our seafood since 2014, harming our communities & economy. @SenDanSullivan & I are pushing Congress & the Biden Admin. to sanction Russian seafood, & equalize treatment of Alaska’s world-class seafood https://t.co/M0jLlnx5Ps
I appreciate Alex Cleghorn of the @alaska_center’s support of the bipartisan reauthorization of the Violence Against Women Act (#VAWA). https://t.co/YiWtzNVAAq

Chris Collins’ suicide awareness initiative is spreading a message of hope across Northwest Alaska—& using the Kotzebue Iron Dog as his platform is a brilliant way to raise awareness of this issue. I applaud Chris’ efforts to make a difference. https://t.co/7kj1D9cHE0
Good to be home. #Alaska https://t.co/k9fubaYiCu

Every victim needs to know that there can be a path to justice. The Violence Against Women Act #VAWA will help ensure that more women are safer—and that’s our ultimate goal with this legislation. https://t.co/KgbMZSONWu

Thanks to a major grant from Matson, a new ocean education center will be built at @akwildlife—allowing for locals & visitors to participate in education programs highlighting Turnagain Arm’s spectacular natural environment. https://t.co/Dfx2nFTG7H
I’m grateful for the support from Vivian Korthius of the Association of Village Council Presidents on the bipartisan reauthorization of the Violence Against Women Act (#VAWA). https://t.co/m0mXKPret6
https://t.co/PPVJMCV8HK

In a letter I wrote with @SenAngusKing and colleagues to @SecBlinken, we emphasized the importance of having a comprehensive Arctic diplomacy strategy—and to ensure the Arctic receives the appropriate attention from @StateDept to promote American interests. Read our letter here:

One of the biggest challenges Alaskans face is not knowing where to turn for help during a crisis. The Alaska 211 system connects community resources specialists w/ those in need of help finding services & resources. I thank those working at Alaska 211 for their work. #211Day
Thank you Michelle Demmert of @AKNWRC for her support of the bipartisan reauthorization of the Violence Against Women Act (#VAWA). https://t.co/Bv3vrU8U26
This is a perfect addition to a sanctions package meant to show Russia that undermining and disrupting global norms will not go unpunished.

I’m hopeful that after years of pushing this issue, this Congress and the Biden administration will finally agree to equalize the treatment of Alaska’s world-class seafood by restricting imports of Russian seafoods.
Americans—and especially Alaskans—have faced a one-sided Russian embargo on our seafood, allowing Russia’s economy to benefit while U.S. seafood has been harmed. https://t.co/o2eK0ea0Hx

The Boots 2 Brews program at @ZipKombucha in Anchorage is helping people find a new career when they leave the military—providing internships to members during their last months of active duty. Thank you to owner Jessie Janes, for supporting the military and veteran community. https://t.co/yvdE6iwosu

Thank you to the @USCG whose heroic efforts saved the lives of 2 fishermen who were on a sinking vessel near Sitka—reminding us all of the importance of being prepared on the water and to remember the brave work the Coast Guard does on a daily basis. https://t.co/6yYY2XzuSj

This bipartisan reauthorization of #VAWA addresses those existing problems and will help prevent violence, support survivors, and hold perpetrators accountable for their violent actions. I thank all the advocates who have supported this legislation. https://t.co/KB8hJ9dZKp

I included provisions to combat teen dating violence, protect women at risk of lethal abuse by convicted domestic violence offenders, improve access to trauma-informed care for all victims of violence, & expand access to medical forensic exams for survivors of sexual assault.
Our bipartisan #VAWA reauthorization package includes my Alaska tribal public safety empowerment pilot program, aimed at addressing the public safety crisis in Alaska Native Villages.
In Alaska, we know we must do a better job when it comes to protecting women. Communities all across Alaska have lacked means to seek help or justice for far too long. https://t.co/8O1alkV7XY
I’m proud to have delivered on this legislation and look forward to the tangible benefits we will see as a result.

The impact of the bipartisan infrastructure law will benefit Alaskans for generations to come—strengthening our economy, connecting communities, and enhancing our workforce and technologies. https://t.co/TwXqx1Lyvz

This legislation will help communities in preventing violence toward women and children and keep them safe. That is our ultimate goal. #VAWA 
https://t.co/PuZovqvum4

I thank @SenFeinstein, @SenJoniErnst, and @SenatorDurbin for working w/ me on this legislation, & appreciated hearing support for our bill from advocate Angelina Jolie, representatives from violence prevention & law enforcement groups & survivors of domestic violence.
The provisions in the bipartisan Violence Against Women Reauthorization Act will not only address barriers survivors experience in seeking justice, but will also save lives. https://t.co/nqPebcWjam
Or watch here: https://t.co/0xpuQJeVJ3

Tune in @ 3:30pm EST/11:30am AKST to join my colleagues @SenFeinstein, @SenJoniErnst, @SenatorDurbin & I as we hold a press conference on the Violence Against Women Act.
 
You can watch it live here: 

https://t.co/nKmnfsLBZo

.@SenDanSullivan, @RepDonYoung & I met with the Alaska House Labor & Commerce Committee to discuss the bipartisan infrastructure law—& the opportunities for our state within it. https://t.co/sJiIwo6UUA

I pressed Laura Daniel-Davis, nominee to Assistant Secretary of the Interior to Land and Minerals Management, on a number of Alaska priorities during a Senate ENR hearing, and was disappointed w/ many of her answers. https://t.co/CAXpJXloyD

Part of my job is to make sure the Secretary of the Interior has a team that will facilitate the safe, responsible production of our domestic resources—including, and especially, in Alaska. https://t.co/P1HCEWbNqs

Happy 35th Anniversary to Juneau’s @AlaskanBrewing Company!

Thank you for all you’ve done for our communities—from being an Alaska favorite to strengthening the local economy.

Looking forward to seeing what’s in store for your growing business for the years to come. https://t.co/bXHXoPaiBe https://t.co/8vJb83RbST

ICYMI—it was great to speak with @Sen_JoeManchin on @JakeTapper’s #CNNSotu, where we discussed bipartisanship, getting things done for the good of everybody, and my focus on always putting Alaskans first.  https://t.co/WBED1aaqe7

Alaska’s fisheries and seafood sectors are critical drivers of our state’s economy, and subsistence lifelines for people across the state.

Going forward, it’s critical the fishery disaster declaration process moves faster and is more transparent. 
https://t.co/fpr3pJGqHg

The opportunities within the bipartisan infrastructure law I helped author are major for Alaska—& it’s critical that we work together to plan, monitor, & apply for grant opportunities.

Our state’s future is brighter thanks to this bipartisan effort—& it’s going to keep us busy. https://t.co/MEZtdu7nqB

As 80% of Alaskan communities aren’t connected by road, it was important I explained Alaska’s unique infrastructure needs to my colleagues during our work on the bipartisan infrastructure bill.  
 
Listening and learning allowed us to build consensus on this consequential law. https://t.co/n1BlwpALT9

Began the morning with my friend @Sen_JoeManchin on @CNNSotu and ending the evening with family dinner together. This is how to build relationships to bring the country together—from Alaska to West Virginia. https://t.co/bR3rw0wBdY https://t.co/e5etTq7mvf

.@ANSEP_AK is an outstanding program that has been supporting Alaska Native students for years—preparing kindergarteners through Ph.D. students for success. 

Their investment in our students makes Alaska a better, stronger, state. https://t.co/PKTi5RoMPi
#BehindTheScenes with @jaketapper and @Sen_JoeManchin on #CNNSOTU this morning for a substantive conversation about what our country needs—bipartisanship. https://t.co/gL39PVQgby
Looking forward to the discussion on bipartisanship with @Sen_JoeManchin and @JakeTapper on today’s @CNNSotu. https://t.co/UJpKQf5snB

Each of these nominees are exemplary candidates who demonstrate incredible discipline & potential.

It gives me great pride to nominate these impressive young people to our U.S. Military Service Academies. https://t.co/uU4XBJ6U2S

It was great to visit Coasties stationed on the @USCG Cutter Hickory in Homer. Whether servicing aids to navigation, conducting fishery boardings, or saving mariners in distress—I’m grateful for their work in keeping us all safe.  https://t.co/UZqo2Nf8WL

At a Senate Indian Affairs Oversight Hearing I welcomed Alaskan Rosita Worl, & asked how we can continue strengthening the Native American Graves Protection & Repatriation Act—& repatriate sacred human remains & funerary objects back to their communities. https://t.co/E1kExoko2J
As Americans we must acknowledge those tragic events, and we cannot allow a false narrative to be created. We cannot deny the truth—to suggest it was “legitimate political discourse” is just wrong.

What happened on January 6, 2021 was an effort to overturn a lawful election resulting in violence and destruction at the Capitol. We must not legitimize those actions which resulted in loss of life and we must learn from that horrible event so history does not repeat itself.

Today is #WorldCancerDay. 
 
As one of the world’s leading causes of death, it’s critical we continue to fight back against this disease by raising awareness, encouraging regular preventative screenings, and continuing research efforts to end it once and for all.

As the #Olympics kick-off, I’ll be rooting for #TeamUSA and all the incredible athletes representing Alaska this year. From skiing, curling, skating, hockey, and more—I wish all those competing the best of luck.   https://t.co/mQIO1lxqEV
During a Senate Approps hearing, I asked for, & received, @SecRaimondo’s commitment to working with me to make sure Alaska’s unique needs and challenges are met as funds are distributed.
Ensuring access to broadband in Alaska is crucial. Provisions in the bipartisan infrastructure law will go a long way in serving the underserved. https://t.co/MSzeeVgj2D

I appreciate their work to help save lives and build stronger communities. We’ve got more work to do, but it’s because of effort from groups like this that we are headed towards safer and healthier communities.

I had a great virtual meeting with Alaskans from the H.O.P.E. Coalition in Sitka and the Ketchikan Wellness Coalition with @CADCA Alaska, who have been working diligently to prevent and reduce substance misuse in Alaska. https://t.co/yUIhynyUI6

The failure to address legacy wells has long been an issue.

$32M coming directly from the bipartisan infrastructure law will invest in the cleanup of these wells—an issue I’ve been dedicated to working on.
https://t.co/RRb4monnGU

It was recently announced that four projects in Alaska will receive funding from the bipartisan infrastructure law. These grants will: 

✅ Invest in Alaska’s infrastructure
✅ Create jobs
✅ Strengthen the economy https://t.co/hM4fQzlDal

During the Senate HELP hearing on mental health, I asked Alaskan witness Claire Rhyneer about the importance of ending the stigma around suicide prevention, and how to best reach Alaska’s children and youth with resources in schools.  https://t.co/gbYrfQf7VN

Exciting news out of the valley—the Mat-Su Borough is hosting the Arctic Winter Games for the first time in March 2024 following the official signing of the contract. They will welcome thousands of winter athletes from around the world. https://t.co/13mZxLyz8i

Comparing the current divisions in Israel to the criminal conduct of South African apartheid is disingenuous to history, legitimizes violence and antisemitism, and emboldens terrorist organizations committed to the destruction of the Israeli state.
I stand firmly with Israel, one of America’s closest allies, against any attempt to label it an apartheid state. https://t.co/NNcDGB3t6o
Wishing @SenatorLujan a speedy recovery. I’m keeping him and his family in my prayers. https://t.co/7K3lXDLNAb
Thank you @AKNationalGuard for your tireless efforts in keeping Alaskans safe. Your dedication to helping people— no matter the element— is greatly appreciated. https://t.co/4t73C3wnr5

Hoonah is reliant on the tourism industry through cruise ship visitors. It’s because of communities like this that I’ve worked hard on legislation that supports coastal economies by fixing a century-old law that halted cruise ships from coming to Alaska. https://t.co/f3gf7xEksc

Hoonah, Alaska was named one of the top places to travel in the world in 2022 by the @NYTimes—a testament to the strong culture, beautiful scenery, and incredible people of Hoonah and the Southeast region. https://t.co/JaL399u5i1

For resources or help, you can visit:

- National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: 1-800-273-8255

- Alaska Careline: 1-877-266-4357 or text 4help to 839863, 3-11p.m. Tuesday – Saturday, https://t.co/bjHBCXxB0U

I’ve been working on efforts to address this crisis—steps to prevent deaths, help those in recovery & provide better access to treatment. 

For those struggling, know that those of us in Congress are paying attention & are working hard to make sure you can find the help you need.
The statistics of mental and behavioral health, substance use disorders, and suicide in Alaska keep me up at night, because they’re not just statistics—they’re real people who are in pain.
I was proud to invite Alaskan Claire Rhyneer as a witness, who shared her story and spoke to the importance of mental health education for children and youth. https://t.co/QOodzvWHDL

I helped lead a Senate HELP Committee hearing today, where we discussed the growing crisis of mental health and substance use disorders in America, and how to address them in a multifaceted approach. https://t.co/EkSdadzkp8
Happy #LunarNewYear to all those celebrating in Alaska. I hope the #YearOfTheTiger brings you and your family health and prosperity.

The H-2B visa program has long played an important role for seasonal fishing and tourism businesses across Alaska.

I appreciate the release of additional visas for additional workers to supplement our local workforce. https://t.co/R0ZEZyDg7P

I appreciated the opportunity to speak with the @PenClarion. From the development of infrastructure projects as a result of the bipartisan law I helped author, to ensuring we can tap into Alaska’s energy resource wealth—I’ve been working hard in the Senate to put Alaska first. https://t.co/pHUv0Vgvop

Due to COVID, this is the first school visit I've been able to do for some time, so it was extra special to visit with students & teachers in their classrooms. I commend Mountain View Elementary for putting education and kindness first. #AKlearns

Education is the engine of Alaska’s future and Mountain View Elementary is laying the groundwork to make that future bright. It was great to get an update from @kpbsd Superintendent Clayton Holland and Principal Karl Kircher and his staff. https://t.co/mlv7sQRrUV

I’m working hard in D.C. to help ensure that Alaskans have the support they need to navigate the #COVID19 pandemic. While in Soldotna, I sat down with a group of representatives from local businesses to hear about their personal experiences over the past two years. https://t.co/ILTzCvJxGu

The Alaska VA recently opened the Soldotna Community Based Outpatient Clinic. One of my top priorities is to ensure America’s veterans have access to quality care. With this impressive new facility, I’m confident Alaska’s veterans will receive just that. https://t.co/b9TaBsYnGg
As co-chair of the Senate Small Brewers Caucus, I enjoy stopping by our local breweries while I’m in town. Great to chat with owner Steve McCasland at the Homer Brewery! https://t.co/OtzGYjpK6r

Project GRAD’s mission is to drive generational change by bolstering the educational experience of underserved students. I appreciate their work to provide equitable, culturally relevant learning opportunities for young Alaskans. https://t.co/AxyBf1LUH0

While in Homer, I stopped by the Kachemak Bay Family Planning Clinic. I appreciate them giving me a walk-through of their facility and sharing information about the many healthcare services provided for the southern Kenai Peninsula. https://t.co/detGJLR5Yv

It was great to meet with the City of Homer and local leadership to get an update on their top priorities and to discuss potential opportunities of the bipartisan Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act. As I work to best represent Alaskans, these conversations are so important. https://t.co/TFH3nwW3PQ

I was glad to join @USCG Rear Admiral Nathan Moore on Cutter Hickory in Homer. Meeting with hard-working Coasties - men & women who sacrifice so much to keep us safe - was gratifying. I appreciate Admiral Moore for his leadership and all our military for their selfless service. https://t.co/L2I326JQK3

It was a privilege to be able to speak with his sisters and family as we honored Commander Charvet’s service. He made the ultimate sacrifice for our country, and we all are safer because of his bravery. https://t.co/GtEhr1oznH

Commander Paul Charvet, a Navy pilot, was killed in Vietnam in 1967, disappearing and being declared killed in action. Decades later his remains were identified, and this week, his remains arrived in Anchorage. https://t.co/fhTTXR2eGz
Ended my day in Fairbanks at @HooDooBrew Company. Nothing like capping off the day with a cold beer and a warm fire! https://t.co/sdnwZVsRuy

I met with a group of female soldiers in Fort Wainwright this week and was grateful to hear their perspectives serving in the U.S. Army.

I appreciate the bravery and effort of these women for keeping our nation safe. https://t.co/rtkKf67A8U

As a member of the Senate Bipartisan Task Force for Combatting Antisemitism, I join my colleagues in remembering the 6 million Jews murdered during the Holocaust.

Together, we have the power to combat antisemitism and vow #NeverAgain. 

#InternationalHolocaustRemembranceDay
It was an honor to drop the puck for a recent matchup between @anchoragewolve1 and @fbx_IceDogs. Great game! 🏒 https://t.co/pTxBKyL8cQ
The predictable is now a full-blown predicament, with no good answers other than those that should have been put in place long ago.

Meanwhile, the Biden administration openly contemplated a ban on U.S. oil & gas exports for months, and has made decision after decision to limit production in Alaska and elsewhere. Now, they find themselves scrambling for foreign supplies to avert a crisis we’ve all seen coming.
The lack of an alternative to Russian oil and gas undercut some countries’ willingness to respond then, just as it does now, especially with some having doubled down on Russian supply.
My reaction is: what a mess. Let’s remember, the threat of Russia cutting off its oil and gas is not new. We all witnessed it in 2014, when Russian invaded Crimea. https://t.co/M5epH1RKLk

@rasmuson @ANSEP_AK With Ed’s passing, we have lost a leader and visionary, but his generous spirit lives on in his family and in the foundation they created. As we look back at his incredible life, Verne and I share our condolences with Cathy, Natasha, and all of their family and friends.

@rasmuson @ANSEP_AK I saw him make a fortune in business, and then use it to make a difference in the lives of Alaskans through philanthropy. That was Ed: always creating value for our state, and recognizing that Alaska’s real wealth is in the spirit of our people and the land itself.
@rasmuson @ANSEP_AK I have been lucky to know Ed for most of my life. I was a young girl living in Wrangell when he began his banking career there, and he has been a close family friend ever since.

After he retired from banking, Ed grew the @rasmuson  Foundation, where he continued to empower Alaska to be more independent & self-sustaining. He spent the past few decades giving back to people & communities in big and small ways, from the @ANSEP_AK to a playground in Yakutat.
As a banker, Ed focused on economic development, and the investments he made possible helped to build our young state.

The passing of Ed Rasmuson is a loss for all of us. 
 
Ed had a heart the size of Alaska, and dedicated his life to the state he loved so dearly. 
https://t.co/070rJ4z1G1

I’m calling on @SecDebHaaland to visit King Cove to see the need to protect local residents’ health and safety as soon as possible. The Secretary must recognize this and act now, because King Cove needs this life-saving road more than ever.

Today marks 8 years since Sally Jewell rejected a short, one-lane, gravel, life-saving road needed to connect King Cove, AK to the all-weather airport in nearby Cold Bay. A total of 157 medevacs have occurred in King Cove since that awful decision.
